atten3.ptxt: Take extra care when handling these precision electronic components.

s2.ptxt: Twist the screwdriver in the direction of the arrow in the illustration, and open the transmitter housing cover.

atten3.ptxt: Do not forcibly pry the cover.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s2.ptxt: Remove the door control transmitter module.

atten3.ptxt: When replacing the transmitter battery, before starting work, remove static electricity that has built up in the body by touching, for example, the vehicle to prevent the door control transmitter module set from being damaged.

s2.ptxt: Detach the hook of the transmitter battery's cover and remove the cover.

atten3.ptxt: When replacing the transmitter battery, before starting work, remove static electricity that has built up in the body by touching, for example, the vehicle to prevent the door control transmitter module set from being damaged.

item.ptxt: When replacing the transmitter battery, before starting work, remove static electricity that has built up in the body by touching, for example, the vehicle to prevent the door control transmitter module set from being damaged.
Do not push the terminals with your finger.
Do not forcibly pry up the battery (lithium battery: CR2016). The terminals may become damaged.
Do not touch the battery with wet hands. Water may cause rust.
Do not touch or move any components inside the transmitter. It may cease to work.
